result.execSummary:
The defendant Torcel Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Torcel Thomas in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Torcel Thomas in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court ordered sentence WITHHELD with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year:


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
 
      *  As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve a total of 60 days in the House
          of Correction.
          30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed 
          to be used at agent's discretion. 
      *  Defendant to serve an additional 30 days in the House of 
          Correction. Huber release for electonic monitoring,
          job search, and work ONLY: Report date: December 28, 2015 by 9:00 a.m.   
      * Defendant to participate and cooperate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
      *  Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by June 10, 2016. 
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry 
          of a civil judgment shall be imposed.
 .
Appeal rights given,
     
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights; received and filed.

Defendant Torcel Thomas in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNT 2:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 31. For reasons stated on the record, All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserved Branch, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse. Court ordered DNA sample after today's proceedings.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Torcel Thomas in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37. Will process notice of hearing as October 1, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. the COURT IS DOWN. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with QUHEM L.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Torcel Thomas in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Torcel Thomas in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge SIEFERT.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge DEE, Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
